title: Understanding the Problem
text: To find the temperature at which solid and liquid ammonia are in equilibrium, use the relationship between enthalpy (∆H) and entropy (∆S).

title: Gibbs Free Energy Equation
text: Use the Gibbs free energy equation for phase equilibrium: [ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - $$T \Delta S$$ $$=$$ 0] where ΔH is the enthalpy of fusion and ΔS is entropy of fusion.

title: Calculate Temperature
text: Rearrange the equation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - $$T \Delta S$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ to find the temperature T: [T $$=$$ ΔH/ΔS].

title: Units Conversion
text: Ensure the units are compatible when calculating. Convert kilojoules to joules if needed: $$1$$ kJ $$=$$ $$1000$$ J .

title: Final Calculation
text: Use the given values: ΔH $$=$$ $$5.65$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ $$=$$ $$5650$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$ and ΔS $$=$$ $$28.9$$ $$\frac{J}{K·mol}$$ . Calculate the temperature T.
